data.description: Examines the construction of whiteness in the United States from the colonial period to the present with an eye to the ways in which Chicanx  Latinx communities have engaged with whiteness. Learn and apply a variety of relevant racial theories to historical cases, exploring the process of racialization through specific racial projects in time and space. Evaluate theories about identity, citizenship, and justice that influence contemporary anti-racist praxis and develop writing skills through essays that take positions on debates within Chicanx  Latinx studies.
data.title: RACIAL FORMATION AND WHITENESS
